title: By-elections in Italy
text:
By-elections () are held in <a href="Italy">Italy</a> whenever a parliamentary seat becomes vacant in either the <a href="Chamber%20of%20Deputies%20%28Italy%29">Chamber of Deputies</a> or the <a href="Senate%20of%20the%20Republic%20%28Italy%29">Senate of the Republic</a>. By-elections were introduced by the <a href="Italian%20electoral%20law%20of%202017">electoral law of 2017</a>.
Overview.
The new Italian electoral law approved in 2017 and nicknamed "<a href="Rosatellum">Rosatellum</a>", provides the election of members of Parliament in 232 <a href="single-member%20district">single-member district</a>s for the <a href="Chamber%20of%20Deputies%20%28Italy%29">Chamber of Deputies</a> and in 116 for the <a href="Senate%20of%20the%20Republic%20%28Italy%29">Senate of the Republic</a>. Whenever a seat of this kind becomes vacant, a <a href="by-election">by-election</a> is called, and a new representative is elected.
